results.title: Vibrato
results.creator_credit: Gerald Hagner, Gerald Hagner Productions and Ohio Arts Council
results.brief_description: Using camera movement, multiple images, and synchronised music to transform nature into a statement of beauty, Gerald Hagner’s award winning film presents a stunning impression of the Appalachian mountains. Without narration. Photographed by Gerald Hagner alone in the Appalachian Mountains, Ohio and synchronised music by Art Kempel.

results.title: VFL: skills
results.brief_description: Step-by-step Australian Rules instructions, skills and techniques demonstrated by senior VFL players. A vital tool in mastering all aspects of this modern, national game for all kids. Includes interviews with Dennis Carroll, Tim Watson and Todd Viney. No other credits available.

results.title: Veterans of the road
results.creator_credit: Esso Petroleum and Veteran Car Club of Great Britain
results.brief_description: Tells the lighthearted story of a Veteran Car Club Rally of vintage cars, held at Abingdon, in Berkshire. Of quaint appearance (none of a later vintage than 1916) and still lively performance, they are seen being submitted to tests of speed, braking and steering, to the delight of many onlookers.

results.title: Vert bleu terre = Green blue ground
results.brief_description: A rather amusing and quirky animated claymation film about two worms, one green and the other blue, trying to outsmart each other over an apple.
results.description: A rather amusing and quirky animated claymation film about two worms, one green and the other blue, trying to outsmart each other over an apple.

holdings.name: MPEG-2 Digital File; Memory Grid Pod Full Encode

results.title: Velocity stock footage
results.brief_description: Using 16mm filmed sequences of motion through different urban and natural spaces, this footage will create a sense of vertigo and velocity across different planes of movement; through space as experienced via car or foot; above space as experienced through elevators and mechanical escalation and across space as experienced via train and so forth. Across different passages of time and space “day, night, city, underground, suburban, rural, alleyway and so forth” the material will imaginatively explore the way a viewing experience can defy human motion and create a dizzying, disorienting but at all times wondrous and alluring moving image experience.
results.description: Using 16mm filmed sequences of motion through different urban and natural spaces, this footage will create a sense of vertigo and velocity across different planes of movement; through space as experienced via car or foot; above space as experienced through elevators and mechanical escalation and across space as experienced via train and so forth. Across different passages of time and space “day, night, city, underground, suburban, rural, alleyway and so forth” the material will imaginatively explore the way a viewing experience can defy human motion and create a dizzying, disorienting but at all times wondrous and alluring moving image experience.

results.title: On the trail of the torturers
results.creator_credit: Michael Ryan and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
As Greece prepares for its first democratic election in a decade, “World in Action” focuses on the torturers who were recruited by the former dictatorship to “discourage” opposition. This is a powerful and confronting documentary containing graphic accounts by both the torturers and the victims of torture.

Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: Tip of the iceberg
results.creator_credit: Steve Morrison and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
The problem of toxic industrial waste poses environmental problems around the world. This film investigates the dangers of the dumping of tons of toxic waste on an industrial tip near the Avon Age fortress of Sutton Walls, Hertfordshire, and near farmland in Matlock, Derbyshire.

results.title: Killer dust: a standard mistake?
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Twenty thousand workers in the asbestos industry in Britain alone risk contracting fatal lung diseases - including lung cancer. This film indicates that the safety level is far too low. One solution to the problem may be to abandon some asbestos products.

Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: The Dumping grounds
results.creator_credit: John Shepherd, Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at the issue of the makeshift Bantu reservations to which the South African Government is transporting whole communities in furtherance of its “separate development” policy. Reveals an appalling catalogue of mismanagement and neglect on the part of those responsible for this mass transportation of people - and on the Bantu side a total crushing despair.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shepherd, Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International
results.description:

Reveals an appalling catalogue of mismanagement and neglect on the part of those responsible for this mass transportation of people - and on the Bantu side a total crushing despair.
